intro: Hemsleya delavayi var. yalungensis, commonly known as the Yalung bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of western China, particularly in the Yalung River valley. The plant is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers a cool, moist climate. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in specialized horticulture and botanical gardens.
